properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts, damaging hail and heavy rain this evening. Boaters may be surprised by strong wind gusts over bodies of water. ### Very large hail can damage property, break windows, dent vehicles and cause serious injury. Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-10T07:59:57-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-09T23:37:57-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4287874767.2020

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms this evening that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to PEstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #PEStorm.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 7:33 p.m. ADT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. Radar indicates that between 20 mm and 30 mm of rain will fall over the next hour. Potential rainfall rates: in excess of 25 mm/h. Total rainfall: possibly 35 mm Potential wind gusts:70-90 km/h Locations: 35 km northeast of Doaktown, heading south at 30 km/h Time span: ending by 8:30 pm ADT. Remarks:A severe thunderstorm with heavy downpours, followed by small hail and gusty winds will move away from the county in the next hours. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-07-10T01:32:54-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-09T22:34:54-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2306776423.2020
Area: Stanley - Doaktown - Blackville Area
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 35 knots, frequent lightning and hail. Radar is detecting numerous thunderstorms which will affect southern Gulf-Magdalen and portions of Northumberland Strait this evening. The storms should dissipate later this evening. ### Large hail can damage vessels and cause injury. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2020-07-10T04:02:12-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-09T23:59:12-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3892095114.2020
Area: Gulf - Magdalen, Northumberland Strait

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 8:37 p.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a cluster of severe thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts and heavy rain. This cluster of severe thunderstorms is located from Londesborough to Clinton and is nearly stationary. Locations impacted include: Seaforth, Londesborough, Roxboro, Huron East, Brucefield, Harpurhey, Egmondville, Harlock, Winthrop, Leadbury and Walton. The main threat from this cluster of thunderstorms remains heavy rainfall rates of 50 mm per hour or more and wind gusts to 100 km/h. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles.
